citation.article-title: Roseivivax lentus sp. nov., isolated from a tidal flat sediment, and emended description of the genus Roseivivax Suzuki et al. 1999
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Roseivivax Suzuki et al. 1999
The description of the genus Roseivivax is as given by Suzuki et al. (1999) with the following amendments.
BChl a may or may not be produced.
Anaerobic growth may or may not occur.
Common major polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, an unidentified phospholipid and unidentified lipids.
The DNA G+C content is 59.7–68.2 mol%.
